Title: [Job Summary][Widget Visibility]Verify that User can view Job Summary widget successfully
Description: Validate that Job Summary widget is visible by default and non-removable
Precondition: 1. User is logged in with valid jobs; 2. Dashboard is accessible; 3. Landing page is loaded
Steps: 1. Navigate to dashboard landing page; 2. Locate Job Summary widget area; 3. Observe widget visibility and content; 4. Check widget removal options; 5. Verify widget positioning on page; 6. Confirm widget functionality and data display; 7. Validate widget persistence after page refresh
Expected Result: 1. Dashboard landing page loads successfully; 2. Job Summary widget area is clearly visible and accessible; 3. Widget displays with proper content and formatting; 4. No removal options are available for the widget; 5. Widget is positioned correctly on the page layout; 6. Widget functions as expected with proper data display; 7. Widget remains visible and functional after page refresh
Test Data: Valid jobs available; Dashboard accessible; Landing page loaded

Title: [Job Summary][Drag and Drop]Verify that User can reposition widget successfully
Description: Validate that Job Summary widget can be dragged and repositioned on dashboard
Precondition: 1. User is logged in with valid jobs; 2. Dashboard is accessible; 3. Job Summary widget is visible
Steps: 1. Navigate to dashboard with Job Summary widget; 2. Locate the Job Summary widget on page; 3. Click and hold on widget header area; 4. Drag widget upward on the page; 5. Release mouse button at new position; 6. Observe widget placement at new location; 7. Verify widget functionality in new position
Expected Result: 1. Dashboard loads with Job Summary widget visible; 2. Job Summary widget is clearly identifiable and accessible; 3. Widget becomes draggable when clicked and held; 4. Widget moves smoothly upward during drag operation; 5. Widget is released and positioned at new location; 6. Widget displays correctly at new position; 7. Widget maintains full functionality in new location
Test Data: Valid jobs available; Dashboard accessible; Widget visible

Title: [Job Summary][Time Filter]Verify that User can apply time range filters successfully
Description: Validate that time range filter options update data correctly
Precondition: 1. User is logged in with valid jobs; 2. Dashboard is accessible; 3. Job Summary widget is visible
Steps: 1. Navigate to dashboard with Job Summary widget; 2. Locate time range filter options (24h, 7d, etc.); 3. Click on 24h filter option; 4. Observe data refresh for 24h period; 5. Click on 7d filter option; 6. Observe data refresh for 7d period; 7. Verify data reflects selected time range correctly
Expected Result: 1. Dashboard loads with Job Summary widget and time filters visible; 2. Time range filter options are accessible and clickable; 3. 24h filter selection is registered and highlighted; 4. Data refreshes to show 24h period information; 5. 7d filter selection is registered and highlighted; 6. Data refreshes to show 7d period information; 7. All displayed data correctly reflects the selected time range
Test Data: Valid jobs available; Dashboard accessible; Time filters enabled

Title: [Job Summary][Custom Date Picker]Verify that User can select custom date ranges successfully
Description: Validate that custom date picker allows specific date range selection
Precondition: 1. User is logged in with valid jobs; 2. Dashboard is accessible; 3. Job Summary widget is visible
Steps: 1. Navigate to dashboard with Job Summary widget; 2. Locate custom date picker option; 3. Click on custom date range selector; 4. Select start date from calendar; 5. Select end date from calendar; 6. Apply custom date range selection; 7. Verify data updates to reflect selected period
Expected Result: 1. Dashboard loads with Job Summary widget and custom date picker visible; 2. Custom date picker option is accessible and functional; 3. Date picker calendar opens when clicked; 4. Start date selection is registered and displayed; 5. End date selection is registered and displayed; 6. Custom date range is applied to data filter; 7. Job Summary data updates to show information for selected date range
Test Data: Valid jobs available; Dashboard accessible; Custom date picker enabled

Title: [Job Summary][Pagination]Verify that User can navigate through paginated results successfully
Description: Validate that pagination displays correct number of rows and works smoothly
Precondition: 1. User is logged in with valid jobs; 2. Dashboard is accessible; 3. Job Summary widget is visible; 4. Multiple pages of data exist
Steps: 1. Navigate to dashboard with Job Summary widget; 2. Locate pagination controls at bottom of table; 3. Count rows displayed on current page; 4. Click next page button; 5. Observe page transition animation; 6. Verify new page loads with correct data; 7. Test previous page navigation
Expected Result: 1. Dashboard loads with Job Summary widget and pagination visible; 2. Pagination controls are accessible and functional; 3. Exactly 10 rows are displayed per page; 4. Next page button responds to click action; 5. Page transition shows smooth animation; 6. New page loads with correct data and 10 rows; 7. Previous page navigation works correctly
Test Data: Valid jobs available; Dashboard accessible; Multiple pages of data

Title: [Job Summary][Column Sorting]Verify that User can sort table columns successfully
Description: Validate that column sorting works in ascending and descending order
Precondition: 1. User is logged in with valid jobs; 2. Dashboard is accessible; 3. Job Summary widget is visible; 4. Table has sortable columns
Steps: 1. Navigate to dashboard with Job Summary widget; 2. Locate sortable column headers (Job Name, Ref ID, etc.); 3. Click on Job Name column header once; 4. Observe ascending sort order applied; 5. Click on Job Name column header again; 6. Observe descending sort order applied; 7. Verify data is properly sorted in both directions
Expected Result: 1. Dashboard loads with Job Summary widget and sortable columns visible; 2. Column headers are clearly identifiable as sortable; 3. First click applies ascending sort order to Job Name column; 4. Data displays in ascending alphabetical order; 5. Second click applies descending sort order to Job Name column; 6. Data displays in descending alphabetical order; 7. Sorting functionality works correctly for all sortable columns
Test Data: Valid jobs available; Dashboard accessible; Sortable columns enabled

Loading spinner appears immediately after tab click; 5. Loading animation continues during data fetch; 6. Loading spinner remains visible throughout process; 7. New data displays correctly after loading completes
